title: Lennar Reaches Analyst Target Price
description: In recent trading, shares of Lennar Corp (Symbol: LEN) have crossed above the average analyst 12-month target price of $107.17, changing hands for $109.25/share.  When a stock reaches the target an analyst has set, the analyst logically has two ways to react: downgrade on valuati
content:
In recent trading, shares of Lennar Corp (Symbol: LEN) have crossed above the average analyst 12-month target price of $107.17, changing hands for $109.25/share. When a stock reaches the target an analyst has set, the analyst logically has two ways to react: downgrade on valuation, or, re-adjust their target price to a higher level. Analyst reaction may also depend on the fundamental business developments that may be responsible for driving the stock price higher — if things are looking up for the company, perhaps it is time for that target price to be raised.

There are 12 different analyst targets within the Zacks coverage universe contributing to that average for Lennar Corp, but the average is just that — a mathematical average. There are analysts with lower targets than the average, including one looking for a price of $74.00. And then on the other side of the spectrum one analyst has a target as high as $130.00. The standard deviation is $17.857.

But the whole reason to look at the average LEN price target in the first place is to tap into a "wisdom of crowds" effort, putting together the contributions of all the individual minds who contributed to the ultimate number, as opposed to what just one particular expert believes. And so with LEN crossing above that average target price of $107.17/share, investors in LEN have been given a good signal to spend fresh time assessing the company and deciding for themselves: is $107.17 just one stop on the way to an even higher target, or has the valuation gotten stretched to the point where it is time to think about taking some chips off the table? Below is a table showing the current thinking of the analysts that cover Lennar Corp:

The average rating presented in the last row of the above table above is from 1 to 5 where 1 is Strong Buy and 5 is Strong Sell. This article used data provided by Zacks Investment Research via Quandl.com. Get the latest Zacks research report on LEN — FREE.

summary: Shares of Lennar Corp (Lennennar Corp) have surpassed the average analyst 12-month target price of $107.17, changing hands for $109.25/share. This is usually a reaction to a stock that reaches this target, which analysts may downgrade on valuation or adjust their target price to a higher level. There are 12 different analyst targets within the Zacks coverage universe contributing to the average for Lennar Corporation, but the average is just a mathematical average. The company's stock price has been outperformed by several analysts, including one with a target as high as $130.00. The average rating is from 1 to 5, with the current rating being 1.
shortSummary: Lennar Corp shares rose above the average analyst target of $107.17, indicating potential for price changes based on valuation and business developments.
argos_summary: Lennar Corp's shares have recently surpassed the average analyst 12-month target price of $107.17, trading at $109.25. Analysts are now faced with the decision to either downgrade their valuation or raise their target prices, with estimates ranging from $74.00 to $130.00. This situation prompts investors to evaluate whether the stock's current price indicates further growth potential or if it has become overvalued.
